Reviews.Title: “Cheap accommodation close to Thrifty Parking and Seatac Airport.”
Reviews.Author: kellykk
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for free breakfast and proximity to the Thrifty Parking Rental. We stayed here on a Sunday Night, arriving late afternoon. Our checkin was fine, quick and easy. The room was standard. But the towel rack in the bathroom was not attached to the wall instead it was lying on the floor. The temperature in the room was hard to keep comfortable. The hotel is worn down and in need of updating. The free breakfast was okay, standard free continental. The shuttle service was quick and immediatley available to airport. We did not use the shuttle service back as used Thrifty's shuttle service to get our vehicle. They do not offer stay one night and park free package. You would have to pay for each additional night parking that you would want on your trip, but the parking lot did not appear very secure, so I would not keep my vehicle there. Staff was friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if at all possible.”
Reviews.Author: ruffjrj
Reviews.Content: Booked a room on priceline for a non-smoking room. After checking I went to the second floor to find my room. The stench in the hall way was a cross between diry socks and stale cigaretts. To my suprise I found that I had a smoking room. I asked for a change and was told there were no other room available. It was 2:30 AM so I sleep there anyway. But I will never go back. I could go on about the continental breakfast, which was a farce compared to a Holidya Inn Express, where I will plan on staying in the future.

Reviews.Title: “value for money:)”
Reviews.Author: travelhyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2nd - 4th March. There are clean lobby, tidy room, polite staff. it is also a convinent location near airport. I arrived sea airport at 0730am and ask for shuttle bus which came quite fast. When we found there are no car parking area at night, they would arrange us other place and take us back. However, it took a long time for waiting the staff who could help me keep the luggage before i checked in.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: holly r
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel in december 2011....we booked this hotel because in their ads they say they have "free parking" and we were flying out to mexico the next morning. What we found out was that the parking was only for the night we stayed and we could pay for parking if they happened to have a spot. The rude girl (and i'm saying this lightly) at the front desk said there was no spots available (parking lot was empty) and we would have to find other arrangements. So already annoyed, we checked in and went up to our room. Guess what happened next.....the room was occupied! How embarassing! Now totally upset, we went back to the front desk and confronted the "rude" clerk...she said that she thought the room was empty and then proceeded to pretend to try and find us another room....by now my husband had steam coming out of his ears so we left and went to the Holiday Inn Express. Never going back there and although we complained to management, we never got a response other than they appreciated our feedback!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Tack82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on 3/8 to connect to a flight East the following morning. We checked in at 1100p, Desk Clerk was cooly efficient. I had to go back to the airport to meet my 85 year old parents. When I came back down to catch the shuttle I was informed that the last driver was off and the next driver was late, at her other job. Had to wait 15 min for the Super 8 hotel van to take me to the airport. Once at the airport, with parents in tow was told that because still no driver, we'd have to wait about 20 or so minutes for the Super 8 driver to return. It's 1200 midnight and 40 degrees out side. After numerous calls to see where the driver was we took at $10.00 cab ride to go 1.5 miles. The desk clerk couldn't be less interested in the events. She said these things happen. True, as a 30 year airline employee with hundreds of thousands of miles traveled- it just HAPPENS I'll never stay there again and encourage all others to avoid the hotel too. Rooms are old, worn and hall ways are narrow and filthy. Even at $75.00, just not worth it. Spend the extra at the Double Tree.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Michelle R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my way to dallas and found the room to be very clean. the front desk girl was charming and the shuttle to the airport took 10 minutes. this is a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: We checked in during the snow storm a couple of weeks ago. the lobby was crazy with people trying to get rooms with all the cancelled flights. staff was amazingly courteous and helpful with all the craziness of the situation. the room was already warm and cozy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Shannonlcross
Reviews.Content: It was awesome Great staff breakfast fresh and free. Very clean rooms. All around great experience. Will stay again. Michelle at the front desk is amazing at her job. Very professional and personable.

Reviews.Title: “NEED SOME SECURITY PROGRAM IN PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating by letting New Year's Eve partygoers check in late. The room was clean and they have an outstanding breakfast in the lobby. However, these perks do not compensate for the unfortunate recent incident that my family and I experienced. On the morning of New Year's Day there were 3 cars parked in the parking lot that were vandalized. The hotel does not have any security guard personnel, surveillance cameras nor a security system in place. So if you were to consider staying at this hotel you would have to sacrifice the safety of yourself/family and your personal property/belongings for a cheap night stay and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: ozz20
Reviews.Content: They have a ridiculous and unfair check-in policy. If you don't show by midnight they get rid of your room. More annoyingly, however, even if you call well in advance letting them know that you will not be able to show before midnight, you will still be charged for that night. If you stay at this hotel (which is next to the airport) you better hope you don't have any travel issues (delays) otherwise you will be out of your money.

Reviews.Title: “never a bad room”
Reviews.Author: Patrick and Mer... C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times when we have an early flight out from SeaTac. We have never had a problem. The ladies at the front desk do a great job. And even though they advertise breakfast starting at 6AM, we checked out at 4:30 this morning and there was already coffee, juice, bananas, muffins and cereal out and ready. And the airport shuttle can drop you at the light rail station for a quick train ride into Seattle. We have already booked our return in February

Reviews.Title: “Good Room next to SeaTac”
Reviews.Author: CaroK
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight for an early morning flight. Ours was a good, clean room and right within our budget. I would stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Tino G
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the airport at 9:30 am after a family trip - By the time we got to the hotel, the kids were cranky and dead tired - Check in was after 2pm so really long wait. After 10 minutes or so, lady at the front desk tells us she would upgrade us to a suite with 2 beds which is available right away so we can get some sleep. That's an A plus in my book. Plus, they offered the kids muffins even though breakfast was already closed.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting nightmare”
Reviews.Author: HurdleQueen03
Reviews.Content: Shuttle picked us up as well as an employee. The entire ride to the hotel the employee complained to the shuttle driver how much she hated her job and wanted to move back to Hawaii, and if she could get fired at least she could get unemployment. We were going to mention this to management, but the hotel turned out to be so low class and the front desk clerk was so rude (we stood infront of her desk for a good minute while she finished up a private conversation on her cellphone) we just wanted to make it through the night. Our room was disgusting. The sheets smelt of cologne and sweat and there was hair on the sheets. There were stains all over the floor and on the armchair. We slept fully dressed on top of the bed and wrapped the pillows in t-shirts (we've never ever had to stoop to this level before). The windows did not lock but we were on the second floor, so weren't worried about anyone breaking in. A cord to one of the room lamps had been cut and someone connected the cut end from the lamp to a different cord he cut off of something else and wrapped the entire thing in duct tape...total fire hazard. We've stayed in other Days Inn before and have never had such a bad experience. We picked this hotel due to vicinity to airport and free breakfast, but based on the cleanliness of the rooms we didn't dare eat breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Can I get a tip?”
Reviews.Author: BigVeep10
Reviews.Content: To make a long story short - we asked for a crib. The front desk lady (who was nice) has the other employee (a guy) bring one up. He did, didn't leave right away, hesitate and then left. We went to dinner. Came back and realized, he didn't bring any blankets for the crib (humm). We called down and asked for two blankets. She said no problem. Sent the same guy (only other person working) up. He came with one blanket. Then, he boldly asked for a tip. He said, "Can I have a tip?" I was dumbfounded for a moment and had to realize what was going one. I asked him if he as serious. He said he was. I then told him we were are two other Days Inn in Seattle & the Olympic Peninsula (good experience) and were never asked for tips (the hotels were better overall as well). He said every hotel is different. Then asked for a tip again. I asked him if he was kidding and he said no and asked again for a tip. I told him I don't have any cash right now (not that I was going to tip him anyway) and here's the kicker - he said he'll come back later for the tip...WTF? I didn't mention yet our first room that smelled like bug spray and was about 90 degrees. I also haven't yet detailed the super thin walls or how the chair I'm in has the arm rest falling out and the crib itself has screws loose in it! Last, there's no manager here. We have a late check in so we're currently stuck here...but tomorrow, I'll be talking the assistant manager before I check out and then talking to the manager on Monday from a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy”
Reviews.Author: volunteeringTrinidad
Reviews.Content: Another Priceline booked hotel. This place was scary and dingy and not clean. The sheets had blood on them. There were cups under the bed from some previous guests. And, the hotel charged us $10 extra because we were 4 altogether staying in the room. The front desk clerk miscoded our cards, so we could not get into our room. Don't book this hotel. It is gross.

Reviews.Title: “Low Price - Needs Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: DavidKfromToronto
Reviews.Content: I needed to overnight near SEATAC airport so I chose this hotel because Days Inn is a national brand, the price was low, and it was very near the airport. The shuttle picked me up at the airport about 10 minutes after I phoned and we arrived at the hotel in about 5 minutes. The driver was very helpful with all my luggage and provided some local information that I requested. Check-in was quick and friendly. It was immediately apparent that this hotel was in need of cleaning and refurbishment as the carpets were stained and I noticed many items around the hotel lobby and in the room that have been "patched". My room had a large jacuzzi but I did not test it. WiFi was free and worked OK in my room. There was only a very small amount of jet noise from the airport and I probably would not even have heard that if I had been running the aircon fan. There are restaurants and convenience shops within a few minutes walk. The "continental" breakfast was very basic. Checkout was quick and the shuttle back to the airport was a repeat of the previous evenings performance. There are many budget hotels near this airport and I will try a different one next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dont knock it till youve tried it...”
Reviews.Author: Lomarty B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this place at the beginning and again at the end of our month long vacation this summer. This place is not a luxury hotel (and it is not priced as such!), but it is far better than what I was expecting. The front desk staff is amazing. They know the area well and were extremely helpful with directions and recommendations. Though I do think there should be more than one staff member manning the desk during busy summer months, they were very, very efficient. The hotel itself provided a clean, and well equipped room. The breakfast was nice as was the free Internet. Though we did not make use of the shuttle, we did encounter a few of the shuttle drivers during or stay, they were laid back and friendly in nature. In fact, all of the staff seemed to be this way. If ever in this area again, I will stay here. My only critique is that the owners and or managers should really consider updating the lobby area :)

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews”
Reviews.Author: rctraveler2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our way to cruise Alaska. the reviews I had read had me scared to death but I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were very clean, the bed was wonderful. There was no airplane noise. the room we had was close to the ice machine which was noisy but we left the fan running all night and after the first night we didn't even hear the ice machine. The breakfast was enough and the desk clerks we very friendly. We would stay again. Its not the Holiday Inn but very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I was very pleased with the hotel and plan to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Brenda P
Reviews.Content: I was picked up at the airport and taken right to the door of the hotel.The driver carried my bags for me. Check -in was quick and easy. The room was clean and the bed was clean and comfortable. There was plenty of hot water for a long shower. The breakfast was great - love having waffles. Much better than a roll and coffee like most places. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I plan to stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I guess there could be a worse hotel but I've never stayed in oneâ€¦.”
Reviews.Author: C00kiebreath10
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this hotel was the worst part of our trip to Seattle with my children and my 90 year old father. We felt we were getting a good deal because we were basically in Seattle for less than $150/ night. I booked a suite so my dad could have some privacy, however both queen beds were in 1 room and a TV and couch (with hide-a-bed) in the other. So we had to share the same bedroom even though there were 2 rooms to this suite. The carpet that covered the floor and was badly in need of replacement. with unsightly unprofessional repairs. The housekeeper only brought 2 sets of clean towels when replacing the 5 sets that she took with her. Although the trash can was emptied no wrappers that littered the tables and floor (from my 3 children) were removed from the room so at first sight, we thought housekeeping had not been there at all. Breakfast food was not restocked until long after it was gone so waiting times to get any breakfast was quite lengthy. Cheap orange (non-juice) substitute for juice in the am as well. Best of stay was the nice man at the 7-11 next door who suggested buy 1, get half-price sandwiches that are brought into his store daily and the shuttle which was quite accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “No room service and poor sound quality”
Reviews.Author: Road1nr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel Aug. 9, 2011. I discovered there was no ironing board and iron in the room after I had taken off my clothes about 9:30 PM. No answer at front desk. Next morning, I tried calling again around 7 AM. I was told I had to come down to the front desk to get an iron and ironing board, that there was no room service. Ridiculous to require someone to put on the wrinkle clothes to go down to get an iron and come back up and undress to iron them. Also, you can hear everyone walking on the floor above you. Prepaid reservations for two but had to pay $10.00 extra for two beds after I arrived. Best thing was the freshness at the breakfast. Person in charge of that kept the room and tables clean, everything filled for your breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamily2012
Reviews.Content: We stopped here with the family on a trip between Vancouver, BC and southern Oregon. The driving directions were easy to follow, staff was friendly, price was reasonable. The room was nothing to write home about but was pretty clean and surprisingly quiet given its proximity to the airport and a main drag. The breakfast was mediocre with almost no healthy options but the two kids loved the waffles. Despite what others have said, there was fresh fruit and lots of hot coffee. The wifi was not working the night we were there and the staff were apologetic but there was a desktop in the lobby that was functional. For a one-nighter with a family, this hotel was quite respectable given the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Not great can get better for similar money”
Reviews.Author: BenJones0001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start and the end of our trip and it's not great. I would have cancelled the second stay if I had not paid upfront to get a good rate. The lady behind the desk was brilliant she gave us good advice about getting into Seattle and getting the Amtrack into Canada but that's about the only good thing I can say about it. Very basic and quite worn out. The place is generally quite noisy and I found it hard to sleep even though I had been up for 28 hours on the first stay and was jet lagged, our room was next to the ice machine which was dropping ice every half an hour or so and kept me up. If I fly into Seattle again I would go for a Holiday inn or Clarion. It does have a frequent shuttle bus but I am sure the others do too. Parking is also free for the nights you are staying there.

Reviews.Title: “If you like noise...”
Reviews.Author: frugallyminded
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly. Breakfast was ok. Noise was terrible: paper-thin walls enable you to hear water running, toilets flushing, people talking, children screaming, airplanes flying, neighbors stomping above you and police chases up the blvd. all between 11pm-4am. If you are a light sleeper, do not recommend. If you can handle waking up 2-3 times per night from the noise, questionable visitors, and a musty smelling, 1980's-styled hotel, this is not the worst place to stay on a budget. The staff was very nice, rooms were clean, breakfast helped saved some money. If you can afford $10-$15 more a night, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to rest”
Reviews.Author: alwynbilly
Reviews.Content: Literally around the corner from the airport. Very snug parking. Decent conti breakfast. Within a block of bus, about 3/4 mile from the train. Shuttle available, so you can go anywhere and get back....

Reviews.Title: “Still a very good value by the airport”
Reviews.Author: GCHHawaii
Reviews.Content: A perfectly good airport inn, at which we have stayed several times. One of the best values in the area. Reception quite pleasant, fair-sized clean rooms with sparkling bathroom facilities. Standard continental breakfast with homemade waffles. Apples or bananas are usually gone fast. Free USA TODAY during the week. Good location, short hotel-airport shuttle ride. A 7/11 store and a decent Japanese restaurant right next door. A lively casino with a restaurant within a 5 minutesâ€™ walk which offers exceptionally good food in big portions at reasonable prices with good serviceâ€”and a good beer selection. The only negative: An untrained, speak cocky, shuttle bus driver who didnâ€™t even open the passenger door and turned on stupid music. Weâ€™ll go back.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, good service, attractive Park & Fly package”
Reviews.Author: suprhoney
Reviews.Content: Booked room and parking on line a month before trip. No problems to park and catch the free airport shuttle, leave our car there for 2 weeks and stayed the night we got back. Wireless internet working as well as 2 public computers available in the lobby, breakfast OK for also being included. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bizzymomsouthernIL
Reviews.Content: We (senior citizen women) stayed here the night before leaving and the night we got back from an Alaskan cruise. I'd read some of the reviews of this place and must admit that I had serious concerns about it, but my friend had made the arrangements so I didn't say anything. When we arrived, we were greeted by Deana, who was very courteous and helpful. The lobby, the room, the bathroom and the shower were clean, and everything worked well. The shuttle van came to pick us up at SEATAC barely 10 minutes after we had called. My only "gripe" would be about the breakfast.....not much of a selection, but what was there was replenished promptly. I'd like to have seen yogurt and perhaps some grown-up cereal such as Special K or Raisin Bran, but the only two options available were the sugar-coated kid-types. I had no problem in using the computer in the lobby to print boarding passes; one of the desk clerks was using it when I came in, and she quickly signed off so that I could access it. All in all, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All right but no better”
Reviews.Author: travelermuc27
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel for the night before flying out. Shuttle is OK but does not run very frequently (every half hout), the hotel is very close to the airport - in fact walking distance if one has little luggage. Room was fine but breakfast was not much to brag about. In all, the hotel was adequate for the price, though.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Inconsiderate”
Reviews.Author: NoReservations_10
Reviews.Content: I had booked a reservation online the previous day.Got off my early afternoon flight which was around 10am to check in.The Hefty lady behind the counter tells me she has no rooms available Im like hello I made a reservation online.She tells me I have to wait till after 2!Im like are you serious im tired and jet lagged made a reservation which is supposed to guarentee me a room and i come to check in and you dont have a room available!thats is rediculous and very unprofessional I told her i would be checking in else where which cost me more in taxi money and time which i was pressed on because i had an afternoon meeting. I had to check in to a cheap hotel up the pacific highway.I will never try to book a reservation with them they dont keep them i advise anyone to look else where. the fat woman was very rude and unhelpful and did not care how tired i was and that all i wanted was a room that was supposed to be guarenteed for me isnt that why we make reservations??? GO ELSEWHERE!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: terracore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn SEA-TAC with my wife and daughter due to a required overnight stay while en route to a vacation in Mexico and back. We were lured to the Days Inn due to the low price (about $60 including tax), free airport shuttle, and included breakfast. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The airport shuttle was fast and frequent. The van was aged but clean and the driver very friendly. Check-in took only a few seconds and the staff was very courteous. Upon arrival at the room we were greeted by dated decor but the room, including the bathroom, was cleaner than the last two Hilton's I stayed at. The mattresses were old and springy but comfortable enough for a good night's sleep. The in-room coffee maker was much appreciated. The room had a weird layout where the sink and bathroom counter were in the main part of the room and offered no degree of privacy. The bathroom had a full sized tub and toilet but no place to put anything. With the bathroom door closed there was barely enough room to change clothes. This is not a hotel room where you would want to spend any amount of time in but we were there only to sleep and it worked out perfectly for our needs. Climate control, television, and coffee maker all worked great. The free wi-fi worked well on my daughter's i-touch but it would not work on my PDA. After examining their network I traced it down to having multiple routers with the same broadcast ID which doesn't always work well with older handheld devices. The included breakfast included cereal, muffins, toast, and waffles. There was no protein (eggs, meat etc) or fruit. There was Sunny Delight but no real juice available. If you are into a big hearty breakfast, don't expect to get it here. There is no such thing as a free meal. The included breakfast was on par with the price of the hotel so there were no complaints. This hotel was only a few minutes from the Seattle Airport. There were a lot of restaurants and a small casino within short walking distance of the hotel. Everything from fast food to fine dining was available. A 7-11 was two doors down. The location was very convenient. The business center consisted of one computer in the lobby of the hotel. A teenager was monopolizing it when I wanted to print out my boarding pass and the front desk clerk offered to kick him off for me, but I did it myself. Being that there was only one computer available a policy against wasting time on teen sites would be a good idea since most guests aren't as assertive as I can be and might be inclined to wait politely instead of taking charge of the situation. When we returned to the Days Inn about a week later on the way back from our vacation the hotel staff remembered and welcomed us. This hotel was an excellent value and lived up to all it promised plus more. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight near airport”
Reviews.Author: karissa6802
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the proximity to the Sea-Tac airport, and the fact that they advertised a free shuttle to/from the airport. This hotel worked out great. When you land you have to call the hotel to request that the shuttle pick you up. They asked us which island we were at and were told that they would be there shortly. We waited about 15 minutes and they were there. The driver loaded all luggage for us and then unloaded onto a luggage cart at the hotel, which was very helpful because I was alone with two small children. Check in was a breeze. The room was very clean and spacious. We had a room with just one queen size bed, but they obviously could have fit another in the room, so it gave the room a very open feel. The continental breakfast in the morning, which is included with room, was very good. They even had a waffle station where you could make your own belgian waffles. No problems checking out. The shuttle back to the airport leaves every half hour, and we were the only ones waiting for the time that we left, so there was plenty of space. All in all, this hotel was an excellent choice for the price. It worked perfectly for what we needed, a short stay overnight and then back to the airport. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone else in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thumper1793
Reviews.Content: I feel this is a great place to stay, price is great, people were very helpful at the desk. Rooms were very clean, didn't notice a smell that people are speaking of. Close to airport which is nice when traveling. Shuttle driver was great and was at airport within 10 minutes of call. There are no complaints here. Stayed here Christmas Eve, then when we came back through on the way home, we will be here 2 nights. Thanks to the helpful staff for making our seattle trip a nice one. Plan to stay here if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Barely okay, free Internet Service was undependable.”
Reviews.Author: mluke1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located about a mile south of the SEA airport. Bed was fine. Sheets were clean. Bathroom was small but okay. Carpet was dirty. Free Internet service signal was not strong in my room. I was unable to connect to it the first day, only able on the morning of the second day. I went to the front counter to complain about it but they had no solution. Lots of noise from adjacent rooms. Walls must be thin. No view to speak of, the window looked out at a rental car place next door. Free breakfast had no fresh egg products. They did have batter to make your own waffles. Had orange juice and cereal. They provided a free USA Today. This place is for the bargain seeking consumer.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Steffijean
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight without reservations, and needed a room closeby the airport for our 9:00am departure. The room that we got smelled really bad. It had a jacuzzi in the bathroom, with a frosted window to the main room that wouldn't shut, so NO PRIVACY. I think the smell was a combination of mold, mildew, and smoke covered up by an awful smelling fragance. All I can say is ICK, ICK, ICK. The hotel hallways were long, dirty, and smelled very smoky. The Breakfast was quite the joke, gross muffins, and warm milk and coffee that tasted like warm root water. I would not recommend this hotel to ANYONE, in fact I would say stay far away......

Reviews.Title: “Very good value all around”
Reviews.Author: GCHHawaii
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at that place. Reception friendly--even remembered us. Clean room, clean bedding, clean bathroom. Requested extra pillows showed up in 10 minutes. Breakfast not exciting but quite alright for this hotel range. Friendly shuttle bus driver--quite different from the worst service we have had at San Francisco airport hotels. A casino a block away offers very good (!) food in big portions at affordable prices. We always have dinner there. One more block to the Anglers' Lake Park. Pleasant and well-kept. Kids even swam there-in April.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Angel049
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a place that I will ever stay at again. It was a cheap hotel, but in this case, cheap was not even worth it for what you got. The room had a stench to it. The bed clothes were uncomfortable and very low rate. The window had a close proximity view of the back of a building. The continental breakfast was unappealing and the area looked unkempt to have food in it. The set-up was terrible. The business center was a computer on a table by the check-in counter. I will pay more next time just to have a descent hotel. The only good thing is that it was close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water!”
Reviews.Author: triptogolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before our flight to Mexico. It was close to the airport and the shuttle to the hotel was convenient. We got there, wanting to shower and there was no hot water! The water was tepid at best. I don't think I would stay here again even for one night. The hotel next door offers free parking for 1 week if you are flying out of Seattle. Don't remember the name of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: van_ricer
Reviews.Content: I was just spending a few hours in Seattle before my flight left. I arrived late and the staff was very friendly. The room was not amazing but it was acceptable for what I needed. The bed sheets looked clean, bathroom was usable and the price was not bad. If it was an extended vacation I would not suggest it, but it was very close to the airport and resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: volnak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel one night before an international journey. It was a very good hotel very close to the airport, with lots of restaurants within walking distance. The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Customer service was great. There is excellent city bus transportation in the area. This is a very good hotel, and I will certainly stay here again the next time I fly out of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: unreal99
Reviews.Content: paid for 3 nights on internet got thier the room was dirty service was bad walked in room stayed 5 minutes and left went to comfort suites paid for another 3 nights but much cleaner and comfortable a real sh it hole

Reviews.Title: “Good standard motel”
Reviews.Author: westmorland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start end end of our Northwest States tour. Good clean rooms if not a bit 'worn' and perhaps in need of a little updating. Bathrooms very small but clean and adequate. Breakfast included in price- Juice, baguels, toast cereals, and do it yourself waffles. Airport shuttle was good and left on time (runs every half hour) only a few mins from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, easy to find location”
Reviews.Author: girluncensored
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in one of their jacuzzi rooms and really enjoyed myself. It was only $90 on a Saturday night. The bed could have been a little softer but the pillows were wonderful. The contenential breakfast included waffles (you had to make your own with an iron), cereal and muffins. I think some fruit or pastries would have been nice. The hotel is very basic (just like any other Days Inn) but it is clean and has a decent location close to I-5. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again if I can help it.”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: One of the worst I've ever stayed in. Arrived at 12:00 noon to a desolate hotel with an empty parking lot and was told that no rooms were available until 2pm. Exterior of the hotel is in need of significant repair especially side facing International Blvd. Hotel is also directly under the flight path of SeaTac Airport and rooms appear not to be soundproofed. Room is old and dated. No closet, only a metal bar with hangers. Work desk was a wobbly and squeky table with a chair that was too low to the ground, and didn't contain a phone. Wall mounted aircon/heat noisy. Hotel claims free wofi, but signal is very week and it tool forever to establish a connection. Only pros are in-room microwave and fridge. "Gym" was a converted guest room on the first floor with three pieces of equipment, one of which didn't work.Blanket on bed was fraying around the edges and so thin you could almost see through it. Unless you get a very good deal bidding on Priceline, search elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable as an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soccer0Team0Manager
Reviews.Content: We needed a one-night stopover near Seattle's Seatac Airport. While this hotel was nothing special, the front desk staff was helpful and courteous, and the place was clean, comfortable, affordable, and more than adequate for our purposes. We had a large group, and the shuttle bus driver made extra trips to accommodate us, which really helped.

Reviews.Title: “Whoa Nelly”
Reviews.Author: bobemac
Reviews.Content: My first visit to a Day's Inn in 25 years. I got this one on Hotwire, and was upset based on TA's reports. This is not a bad property for a two * hotel. My room was 216. It was clean, everything worked, the bathroom was painted, the floor was new, and the shower had plenty of hot water. The front desk clerk/manager Angel was friendly and efficient. She rebooted the wireless router for me, and I had great Internet access for free. The breakfast had a waffle maker, cereal, juice, coffee, yogurt, and mini bagels. There were two kind of muffins. I used the airport shuttle, and it took 19 minutes for a pickup. Drivers were friendly. The exercise area has one non working bike, but the other two machines performed well. In review. Motel was clean, everything worked, it was as sound proof as any airport property. I suggest a lower floor, if you are a light sleeper. I was set for the 4th floor, but they changed me to the second. Friendly employees. This is a solid choice, contrary to other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “They overcharged and tried to get over on me”
Reviews.Author: serenajones
Reviews.Content: I should've visited first but I read decent reviews about this place and then booked a room for some out of town guests that my company was hosting. They checked out early b/c they thought it was not clean and smelled bad. Then Days Inn mistakenly overcharged my credit card for an extra night's stay--- 2 nights after my guests had checked out. I called twice and spoke to staff asking them where the extra charge came from and they said they didn't know but would have someone call back...NEVER HAPPENED. Finally had to dispute the charge with my credit card company. After 2 months of phone calls, letters, faxes and hassles, I finally got my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: pcchicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and left for the airport early because we couldn't wait to get out. The motel was shabby and not too clean. Plumbing noises and slamming doors left two of the three of us awake for most of the night. Food and supplies in the breakfast room were constantly running out and were replaced slowly. There was no fruit to be had. The computer in the lobby was not allowing access to the internet and the receptionist was completely uninterested in doing anything about it. (She was busy doing other tasks even when guests were trying to transact business.) The airport shuttle was a positive feature.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tmi007
Reviews.Content: The only great thing about this place is that it is close to the airport. There was a broken window/door between the bedroom and the bathroom so nothing was private. The service was not friendly or fast and the rates published at the hotel were cheaper than what we got on hotel.com

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: jparet
Reviews.Content: When I booked this, it was rated as a 3 star hotel. Far from it. It is dirty, the carpets need to be replaced, the walls have never been washed, and it looks like previously my room had an attempted break in. The door frame has obviously been damaged by someone trying to force it open. The curtain was broken. When my wife rubbed a white wet towel on the floor the towel became black. nasty nasty nasty. one very positive part of the stay. the staff are very friendly, helpful, and go out of their way to take care of you. the problem is, no matter how nice the people are, there is nothing worse than a dirty, cheap hotel that needs to be torn down and rebuilt.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely HORRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: cozywintersnow
Reviews.Content: I will never, in my life, stay at a Days Inn. This has to be the worst hotel I have stayed in. When I first arrived I noticed the rundown and dirty parking lot, completely unsecure. When I entered the lobby I wasn't even greeted by the woman behind the desk. She was rude, seemed bored and didn't even welcome me to the hotel. Going down the hallway to find my room I noticed two men, dressed in street clothes, pushing the maid carts. I imagine they work there, but they had no nametags or uniform that would identifiy them from the guy down the street. The room smelled of "cheap" everywhere I looked. There were no shampoo, or soaps, the TV remote didn't work, the beds were hard and the linens thin as paper. The carpet was dirty and there ants underneath the sink. Ugh!! I almost felt dirty staying there. Because I booked my room through one of the discount sites, i could not get a refund. I was so angry that I had to stay there or lose my $112. No way I would ever go back! HORRIBLE!!

Reviews.Title: “Last Hotel On Earth”
Reviews.Author: rorus
Reviews.Content: Smelly carpets, smelly corridors, smelly linen, suspect stains on the headboard. Stayed in Jacuzzi room. Could hear my wife going to the toilet not pleasant. This place needs to be bulldozed it's awful. And just to make sure we stayed another 2 nights here before we went home. uuughaahha. sends shivers down the spine. On the plus it's very close to airport and staff are friendly and shuttle service is grand. But, when you learn what we learned when you get there that is there is about 20 other hotels in short walking distance to this hotel surrounding it. They can't be any worse than this dump. Only that I live so far away in Ireland. I would actually start a campaign to get this hole of a place shut down. AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL. Oh! and did I say that this place is AWFUL!! because it is. You may think how can a place be so bad. Find out at your own Peril.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok”
Reviews.Author: jessy79
Reviews.Content: It isn't a vey luxery hotel, there were not many facilities. But for the price we paid the hotel was ok. Clean rooms, good hotel/airport shuttle, wireless internet (we were very happy whit that) The complimantery breakfast was allright, coffee, juices, muffins, bagles, cereals, waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful!”
Reviews.Author: Insearchof
Reviews.Content: This place doesn't have any redeeming qualities. The carpet is terribly stained all over the hotel. As you come out of the elevator the smell of stale smoke permeates the hallway. The beds in the room are hard like cardboard and the linens and blankets felt like sandpaper. The pillows were simply horrible. If you want to sleep comfortably this is not the place to stay. Spend a few dollars more and stay at the Doubletree across the street. That is what I would do if I stayed in Seatac again. The hotel needs to be torn down and they should start from scratch!

Reviews.Title: “Keep on driving!”
Reviews.Author: dearsue
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed is the lack of marking for the entry to the Hotel. We drove around the block after missing it. The carpet in the main lobby, stairs and halls were worn and especially stained and dirty. The room had dirty mattress and box springs sides that were exposed due to ill-fitting sheets and lack of matress covers or dust ruffels. The toilet did not flush efficiently, and almost overflowed. Water pipes groaned and squeeked. The door to the room had a gap at the door jam that was easy to peek through! Other than that, the walls were very thin and all ajoining room sounds were clearly heard. I won't be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFL
Reviews.Content: Having not stayed at this Inn in several years, I was apprehensive, particularly because the rate was very favorable. My checkin was most pleasant, and I found the hotel and room to be in very good condition. The room/bath were clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was adequate...and the checkout, once again, was a pleasant experience. Yes, it is a "basic" stay, but the Inn provided everything I needed...and as been stated before, it is very close to the airport, with shuttle provided.

Reviews.Title: “Servicable”
Reviews.Author: richnindy
Reviews.Content: If you're stuck at the airport just overnight, as I was (in late, out early), this is quite a servicable place to stay. Nothing fancy, but clean and decent for a night's stay. And you can't beat the location and the quick shuttle to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Forget about this one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Broken bed, broken furniture, smelly room, unavailable staff. No service.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service... could work in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very average motel rooms. On close inspection things were dated, but it didn't jump out at you. The bathroom was small. The service at this place was absolutely terrible. Our TV didn't work when we arrived, and when we called the front desk they immediately made it clear this was more our problem than theirs. It took numerous phone calls and 6 hours to get the TV fixed. No one would take responsibility for this problem; someone else was always "on the way up" to fix it. The breakfast went until 9:30 AM. When we showed up at 9:20 AM everything was gone. We asked them to restock a few things, which they did... but very slowly and very grudgingly. The did not seem concerned about or interested in our plight (9 adults and 3 kids without food). They were also clearly understaffed, which explains why they were so slow. The location is convenient to the airport, but not to downtown, especially with traffic - 45 minutes each way. There is free internet in the lobby, but no printer attached (can't print out boarding passes), which seems inexcusable to me for a hotel at the airport with a free airport shuttle. On the plus side: we paid $51 for a room for 4 adults, there is a free breakfast, and there is a free shuttle. Summary: I might stay here again for a dirt-cheap place to crash before an early morning (or after a late night) flight, but would choose a different place if I were going to stay for more than a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport reasonably priced GREAT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: drw2112
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night in Seattle and wanted to catch a Mariners game. This Hotel has a 24 hr shuttle service to the airport that leaves every half hr.They also have a town car and friendly driver who can take you downtown for a much cheaper rate than a cab. The room was pretty spacious and clean and the hotel also had an exercise room and continental breakfast. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous.I would recommend this hotel, we had a nice stay.Also there is a Jack in the Box only a block away which was good, they got great cheeseburgers!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Seattle/Sea-Tac International Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 19015 International Blvd. South, Hwy-99S & S 188th SE, Seattle, WA 98188
